author: Emma Kelly
title: Oscars wrong Best Picture announced is this what happened Leonardo Di Caprio | Daily Star

organizations.name: leonardo di caprio | daily star was
la la land” warren beatty  author kelly oxford

text:
Was Warren Beatty given the wrong envelope? How THAT Oscars error happened Was Warren Beatty given the wrong envelope? How THAT Oscars error happened THE Best Picture cock-up at the 89th Academy Awards could be the most excruciating moment in live TV history. / Published 27th February 2017 
Warren Beatty announced La La Land as the winner of the Best Picture Oscar – only for it to emerge minutes later that Moonlight had actually won. 
Social media went into meltdown as the cast and crew of musical La La Land vacated the stage to be replaced by Moonlight's cast. 
Nobody could quite understand what had happened – but one person reckons they've got it sussed. 
GETTY CONSPIRACY: Was Leo to blame for the epic Oscars gaffe? Oscars 2017: Red carpet LIVE Sunday, 26th February 2017 Oscars 2017: All the red carpet action from the 89th Annual Academy Awards in Hollywood. 1 / 100 “I opened the envelope and it said Emma Stone, La La Land” Warren Beatty 
Author Kelly Oxford claimed that the gaffe was all Leonardo Di Caprio's fault. 
Leo had awarded Emma Stone with the Oscar for Best Actress for her role in La La Land, and was seen picking up the envelope containing her name. 
But Kelly thinks that the envelope was then left for Warren to read. 
She tweeted: "OMG IT WAS LEO's FAULT. HE HAD THE ENVELOPE. 
TWITTER THEORY: Kelly Oxford reckoned Leo left the envelope for Warren Beatty 
TWITTER JUSTICE FOR WARREN: Twitter users claim that Beatty was holding the wrong card 
"LEO CARRIED THAT CARD OFFSTAGE PUT IT DOWN WHEN HE SAW WARREN AND WARREN PICKED IT UP." 
Warren, who was on stage with Bonnie and Clyde co-star Faye Dunaway to present the Oscar, told the crowd at the Dolby Theatre that he had read Emma's envelope. 
He said: "I opened the envelope and it said Emma Stone, La La Land." 
And a close-up on Warren's hands seems to confirm the envelope he was holding read: "Actress In A Leading Role." 
However, backstage in the winner's room, Emma said that she had the envelope the whole time. 
GETTY MIX-UP: Warren claimed he was given the wrong envelope Oscars 2017: Vanity Fair Party Monday, 27th February 2017 Vanity Fair Oscars Party: Hollywood's finest walk the red carpet on the glitziest night in showbiz. 1 / 30 
The star said: "I was holding my Best Actress in a leading role card that entire time. So whatever story… I don't mean to start stuff, but whatever story that was, I had that card. 
"So I'm not sure what happened." 
Two briefcases carrying identical envelopes are carried by employees of PwC for security purposes, so it could be that there was a mix-up of the two envelopes. 
Will we ever discover what truly happened? Let the conspiracies start now. 
Viewers are comparing the epic error to that of Steve Harvey, who announced the wrong Miss Universe winner back in 2015. Related articles
